events.message: The insured reported a car collision involving their vehicle and another on the highway around 8 AM. Initial claim filed successfully.
The claim was reviewed and categorised under Auto Accident due to involvement of the insured's vehicle in a collision.
An insurance agent was assigned to handle the customer's auto accident claim and will coordinate the next steps.
The claim was officially acknowledged by the insurance company, and the claimant was informed that the case will be processed.
The agent requested related documents including police report, vehicle photos, and repair estimates to proceed with investigation.
The insured submitted all required documents promptly, including the police report and detailed repair quotes for the damaged vehicle.
Investigation into the circumstances of the vehicle collision has started, with emphasis on fault determination and damage extent.
The investigation concluded, confirming that the insured was not at fault and detailing the full extent of vehicle damages.
A settlement offer was proposed to the claimant covering repair costs and rental vehicle expenses during repair period.
The insured acknowledged receipt of the settlement proposal and expressed satisfaction with the timely communication and offer.
After final review, the claim was approved in full, confirming the agreed settlement amount for the vehicle damage.
The settlement payment was issued to the insuredâ€™s account for repairs and associated costs related to the auto accident.
The claim was officially closed following payment issuance and confirmation of repair completion by the insured.
The fully processed auto accident claim has been archived for record-keeping and future reference if needed.
